meanings.definition: To work actively for a political candidate or party
meanings.sent1: During the campaign, she electioneered tirelessly for her favorite candidate.
meanings.sent2: He electioneered by going door-to-door to talk to voters about the candidate.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel electioneered for more acorns by charming the other animals with acrobatics.
meanings.sent4: The sun electioneered its way through the clouds, shining brightly on the campaign rally.
meanings.sent5: She electioneered with such passion that even the undecided voters were swayed.

meanings.definition: To engage in campaigning for an election
meanings.sent1: The volunteers electioneered by putting up posters around town to promote the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: Candidates often electioneer by attending community events to connect with voters.
meanings.sent3: The penguin electioneered for more fish by waddling around the aquarium with a sign.
meanings.sent4: The wind electioneered its way through the trees, rustling the leaves like campaign flyers.
meanings.sent5: He electioneered enthusiastically, leaving a lasting impression on the voters.
